intro: Acrachne vatovae, commonly known as the Socotra starfruit, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Didiereaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant has a succulent, shrub-like appearance with thick, fleshy stems adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or green. Due to its limited geographic distribution and specialized habitat, Acrachne vatovae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
